news_header: Former Prime Minister of Mauritius, Pravind Jugnauth, has been released on bail after his arrest on money laundering charges. He was detained along with three others following raids that uncovered large sums of cash and luxury watches.
news_original_title: Mauritius ex-PM bailed after 'suitcases of cash' arrest
news_text: Jugnauth denies the charges, which come shortly after his electoral defeat. His wife was questioned but released, while his co-accused remain in custody. Jugnauth must adhere to bail conditions that restrict contact with witnesses and require him to stay at a fixed address.
